topquizbackend

Class MultipleChoiceQuestion

  • java.lang.Object
    • topquizbackend.Question
      • topquizbackend.MultipleChoiceQuestion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MultipleChoiceQuestion
extends Question
    The MultipleChoieQuestion class contains the back-end MC Question data and the methods needed in the back-end for the proper execution of front-end methods.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultipleChoiceQuestion()
      Base Constructor for MultipleChoiceQuestion Not advisable to use.
      MultipleChoiceQuestion(java.lang.String questionText, java.lang.String correctAnswer, int score)
      Inherited Constructor for MultipleChoiceQuestion.
      MultipleChoiceQuestion(java.lang.String questionText, java.lang.String correctAnswer, int score, java.lang.String choiceA, java.lang.String choiceB, java.lang.String choiceC, java.lang.String choiceD, java.lang.String choiceE)
      More robust Constructor for MultipleChoiceQuestion This is the advised Constructor to use for this Class, as it is complete Other Constructors for this class will not provide fully-functional MCQs.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultipleChoiceQuestion

        public MultipleChoiceQuestion()
        Base Constructor for MultipleChoiceQuestion Not advisable to use.

      • MultipleChoiceQuestion

        public MultipleChoiceQuestion(java.lang.String questionText,
                              java.lang.String correctAnswer,
                              int score)
        Inherited Constructor for MultipleChoiceQuestion. The params are essentially the same as the super, Question.
        Parameters:
        questionText - String for the Question's text
        correctAnswer - String for the Question's correct answer
        score - int for the Question's point-value score

      • MultipleChoiceQuestion

        public MultipleChoiceQuestion(java.lang.String questionText,
                              java.lang.String correctAnswer,
                              int score,
                              java.lang.String choiceA,
                              java.lang.String choiceB,
                              java.lang.String choiceC,
                              java.lang.String choiceD,
                              java.lang.String choiceE)
        More robust Constructor for MultipleChoiceQuestion This is the advised Constructor to use for this Class, as it is complete Other Constructors for this class will not provide fully-functional MCQs. The first three parameters are inherited from the super-class, and function identically.
        Parameters:
        questionText - String for the Question's text
        correctAnswer - String for the Question's correct answer
        score - int for the Question's score
        choiceA - String for the MCQ's Choice A
        choiceB - String for the MCQ's Choice B
        choiceC - String for the MCQ's Choice C
        choiceD - String for the MCQ's Choice D
        choiceE - String for the MCQ's Choice E

    • Method Detail

      • isCorrectNumericAnswer

        public boolean isCorrectNumericAnswer(int answer)
        Method functions much like isCorrectAnswer() in the Super, only it takes an int for the specific answer-choice. instead of a String.
        Parameters:
        answer - int in range [0-4] (inclusive) denoting a possible answer choice
        Returns:
        boolean in the same vein as isCorrectAnswer() in the Question() class.

      • getChoices

        public java.lang.String[] getChoices()
        Returns:
        the choices

      • getSpecificChoice

        public java.lang.String getSpecificChoice(int choice)
        A more robust getter method which returns a specific answer choice for this MultipleChoiceQuestion
        Parameters:
        choice - int denoting which choice from choices array is desired
        Returns:
        String of the appropriate choice.
